grad prom thingie is tomorrow... that's almost today!! There's so much to do and I'm so unprepared!! This is supposed to be an important night where we all get to look stupid and feel fancier and more important than we really are or will really ever be. Its all so fake, shallow and one-dimensional. Not that pretty much everything else isn't, music is crap, work is crap, news media and pretty much anything anyone says is crap. Am I the only one I can really trust? I'd like to think no, but I know its true, everyone has their spin on things, almost everyone puts their own slant on anything they say. Where is the truth? Is it what I want it to be? Or will I find it through meditation? Or is it through fulfilling my own goals? Or even money and power? Fuck... I really shouldn't have taken philosophy... I'll just go listen to my mom's "Best of Styx" tape... come sail away, come sail away, comesailaway with meeeeeeee

so, now that I have my driver's licence I am the official family chaufeur/errand bitch! i hate going to IGA... its scary... I had to go alone today... I couldn't decide if I should take a cart or basket, I think to meself, I can take a cart and put like two things in it and look like a fucking retard or take a basket and have to much stuff and have to carry some of it and look like a fucking retard... so I take a cart, but its one of those squeaky stupid ones that don't work properly, so I dump it beside some old lady and grab a basket and spend a half an hour looking for pasta and kraft dinner... they need fucking big signs that say "PASTA AND KRAFT DINNER HERE!" with big arrows and bright lights so I won't miss it, IGAs don't need to be all fancy and nice inside, all they need are aisles with everything listed on a large bright sign so people don't have to spend all day looking for something... so, while I'm really lost and trying to read the fucking signs above the aisles, I run into the butcher lady and her spinning bucket of death... I've never understood why dead animal parts need to be put in a spinning bucket thing... aaaanyways, I almost knock her and the spinning bucket of death over and all the old people start giving me dirty looks so I get scared... run to the cash, pay and leave as fast as I can. But only as I get back to the car, do I realize that I parked in the handicapped spot! I'm a fucking asshole!! fuck!! The moral of the story is, always get someone else to go grocery shopping for you, and watch where you're going, running into butcher ladies and spinning buckets of death kinda hurts
